intro: Pisonia petenensis, commonly known as the Petén pisonia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Pisonia petenensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
